prompt: Explain the role of containerization (e.g., Docker) in CI/CD pipelines.

criteria.name: Understanding of Containerization
criteria.description: Demonstrates knowledge of containerization concepts and tools like Docker.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Clearly explains what containerization is, how Docker works, and container benefits.
performance_descriptors.average: Mentions containers or Docker with limited explanation.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Basic or unclear understanding of containerization.

criteria.name: Integration in CI/CD Pipelines
criteria.description: Explains how containerization supports CI/CD processes.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Insightfully links containers to automation, consistency, and deployment in CI/CD.
performance_descriptors.good: Describes main ways containers are used in CI/CD.
performance_descriptors.average: States that containers help CI/CD but with little detail.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Minimal or unclear link to CI/CD.

criteria.name: Use of Real-World Examples
criteria.description: Uses relevant examples to illustrate containerization in pipelines.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Multiple, relevant examples with clear explanations.
performance_descriptors.good: At least one clear example provided.

criteria.name: Structure and Academic Style
criteria.description: Presents answer in a logical, academic style.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Highly organized, formal, and clear response.
performance_descriptors.good: Clear structure and mostly formal style.

key_points: Links containers to automation, consistency, and fast deployment in CI/CD
Gives real-world examples: Spotify, PayPal, open-source projects
llm_questions: Why use containers in CI/CD pipelines?
Can you give examples of companies using containers in CI/CD?
How do containers improve deployment speed and consistency?
